adept.common

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • adept.common.Item
      • adept.common.HltContent
        • adept.common.ArgumentTuple
          • adept.common.Event

  • public class Event
extends ArgumentTuple
    The Class Event, which represents something that happens or is regarded as happening; an occurrence, especially one of some importance. In most cases, the new EventMention class should be used instead of this. See DocumentEvent's documentation for a full description of available event classes.

      • getEventId

        public long getEventId()

        Returns:
        the event id

      • asEventMention

        public EventMention asEventMention()
        Returns an approximation to this Event as an EventMention. All attributes will be copied over with score 1.0. All arguments with non-empty distributions will be copied over to EventMentionArguments with the chunk and score of the best item in the argument distribution. The resulting EventMentionArgument will have no provenance because none is available. If ticket BBN-281 is addressed, this method should be modified to use the now-Chunk-based context field to create an EventText to use as provenance.
        Returns:
